verses.verse: The words<WH1697> of the Preacher,<WH6953> the son<WH1121> of David,<WH1732> king<WH4428> in Jerusalem:<WH3389>
"Vanity<WH1892> of vanities,<WH1892>" says<WH559> the Preacher;<WH6953> "Vanity<WH1892> of vanities,<WH1892> all is vanity.<WH1892>"
What does man<WH120> gain<WH3504> from all his labor<WH5999> in which he labors<WH5998> under the sun?<WH8121>
One generation<WH1755> goes,<WH1980> and another generation<WH1755> comes;<WH935> but the earth<WH776> remains<WH5975> forever.<WH5769>
The sun<WH8121> also rises,<WH2224> and the sun<WH8121> goes down,<WH935> and hurries<WH7602> to its place<WH4725> where it rises.<WH2224>

The wind<WH7307> goes<WH1980> toward the south,<WH1864> and turns around<WH5437> to the north.<WH6828> It turns around<WH5437> continually<WH1980> as it goes,<WH7307> and the wind returns again to its courses.<WH7725>
All the rivers<WH5158> run<WH1980> into the sea,<WH3220> yet the sea<WH3220> is not full.<WH4392> To the place<WH4725> where the rivers<WH5158> flow,<WH1980> there they flow<WH7725> again.<WH3212>

All things<WH1697> are full of weariness<WH3023> <WH376> beyond<WH3201> uttering.<WH1696> The eye<WH5869> is not satisfied<WH7646> with seeing,<WH7200> nor the ear<WH241> filled<WH7646> with hearing.<WH8085>
That which has been is that which shall be;<WH6213> and that which has been done is that which shall be done:<WH6213> and there is no new<WH2319> thing under the sun.<WH8121>
Is there<WH3426> a thing<WH1697> of which it may be said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH7200> this is new?<WH2319>" It has been long ago,<WH3528> in the ages<WH5769> which were before us.<WH6440>
There is no memory<WH2146> of the former;<WH7223> neither shall there be any memory<WH2146> of the latter that are to come,<WH314> among those that shall come after.<WH314>
I,<WH6953> the Preacher, was king<WH4428> over Israel<WH3478> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>

I applied<WH5414> my heart<WH3820> to seek<WH1875> and to search out<WH8446> by wisdom<WH2451> concerning all that is done<WH6213> under the sky.<WH8064> It is a heavy<WH7451> burden<WH6045> that God<WH430> has given<WH5414> to the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> to be afflicted with.<WH6031>
I have seen<WH7200> all the works<WH4639> that are done<WH6213> under the sun;<WH8121> and behold,<WH1892> all is vanity and a chasing<WH7469> after wind.<WH7307>
That which is crooked<WH5791> can't<WH3201> be made straight;<WH8626> and that which is lacking<WH2642> can't<WH3201> be counted.<WH4487>

I said<WH1696> to myself,<WH3820> "Behold,<WH559> I have obtained<WH3254> for myself great<WH1431> wisdom<WH2451> above all who were before<WH6440> me in Jerusalem.<WH3389> Yes,<WH3820> my heart has had great<WH7235> experience<WH7200> of wisdom<WH2451> and knowledge.<WH1847>"

I applied<WH5414> my heart<WH3820> to know<WH3045> wisdom,<WH2451> and to know<WH3045> madness<WH1947> and folly.<WH5531> I perceived<WH3045> that this<WH1571> also was a chasing<WH7475> after wind.<WH7307>
For in much<WH7230> wisdom<WH2451> is much<WH7230> grief;<WH3708> and he who increases<WH3254> knowledge<WH1847> increases<WH3254> sorrow.<WH4341>
